g.text: Do Not Cite, Quote or Distribute
security concerns. The Netherlands has a stringent set of 36 sustainability criteria to which the
certified biomass needs to comply. The EU
sets a timeline for the complete phase
, such as Forest Sustainability Council (FSC) or Programme for the
Certification (PEFC), are consumer driven, voluntary programs that influence
timber harvesting practices, and may reduce emissions from forest degradation with reduced impact
As the area of land devoted to certification has increased, the amount
of timber produced from certified land h
as increased. In 2018, FSC accounted for harvests of 427
and jointly FSC and PEFC accounted for 689 million m
There is evidence that reduced impact logging can reduce
evidence about whether forest certification reduces deforestation
in the food sector encourages more widespread use of conservation
). The number of private commitments to reduce deforestation
chains has greatly increased in recent years, with at least 865 public comm
producers, processors, traders, manufacturers and retailers as of December, 2020
Os, such as the Roundtable on Sustainable
Palm Oil (RSPO), have become more widespread and visible in agricultural production. For example,
RSPO certifies members all along the supply chain for palm oil and claims around 19% of total
ustainability efforts exist for many of the world's major agricultural products,
including soybeans, rice, sugar cane, and cattle.
There is evidence that the Amazon Soy Moratorium (ASM), an industry
tarily not to purchase soybeans grown on land deforested after 2006,
reduced deforestation in the legal Amazon
studies have shown that some deforestation from the Amazon was displaced to the Cerrado (Brazilian
which is a global hotspot for biodiver
These results illustrate the importance of broadening the scope of supply
chain management to minimize or eliminate displacement
environmental outcomes for a time, it is not clear that they are sufficient
term reductions in deforestation, given the increases in deforestation that have occurred
in the Amazon in recent years (Box 7.9). Voluntary efforts would be more
deforestation if they present stronger linkages to regulatory or other approaches
Box 7.9 Case study: Deforestation control in the Brazilian Amazon
the Brazilian Legal Amazon (is a socio
division containing all nine Brazilian states in the Amazon basin) increased from 18,226 to 27,772 km
A set of public policies designed in participatory process involving federal
government, states, municipalities, and civil society
deforestation rates increased after 2013, and particularly between 2019 and 2020. Successful
